thread.title: Roast beef and lemon drizzle cake tea at Uffington
thread.title_full: Roast beef and lemon drizzle cake tea at Uffington - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Roast beef and lemon drizzle cake tea at Uffington
text: Read more about the Great Cricket Tea Challenge Uffington had labelled this their Tea of the Century in an effort to motivate members to produce the greatest halfway repast in the history of the club. Weight of expectation: the savoury-laden table Sweet and savoury were beautifully laid out, with a menu including pork pies and haslet (a large pork meat loaf, which is a traditional Lincolnshire dish), both from the local butcher Muntons – which has family members playing at the club; roast beef, cheese and pickle, and honey roast ham sandwiches made with home-made bread; honey-mustard sausages; sausage rolls; gravadlax; and a huge cheese board. Have your cake: cricket ball, left, and hummingbird, right Then there were the cakes. The humming-bird cake, made by Allyson Percival-Carter, had won Uffington’s very own bake off fundraising event. But there was so much more: a cricket ball cake that had been made by Shelly Burton; cheesecake; Victoria sponge; lemon drizzle cake; and scones – all enjoyed with an urn full of Yorkshire Tea.
